item.title: WNBA season tips off Tuesday
item.description: The 28th WNBA season kicks off Tuesday night with four games, including Caitlin Clark's highly anticipated debut for the Indiana Fever.

item.title: Biden administration announces new tariffs on $18 billion worth of Chinese products
item.description: In a move supported by both parties, the Biden administration is imposing heavy taxes on some products from China. President Biden is announcing new tariffs on $18 billion worth of Chinese-made products like electrical vehicles, semiconductors, batteries, steel and aluminum.

item.title: Michael Cohen returns for second day of testimony at Trump trial
item.description: On Monday, Michael Cohen testified that former President Donald Trump signed off on plans to reimburse him for a "hush money" payment to Stormy Daniels.

item.title: Trump trial analysis after testimony from key witness Michael Cohen
item.description: Robert Costa and CBS News legal analyst Rikki Klieman break down former President Donald Trump's New York criminal trial after Michael Cohen took the stand to testify Monday.

item.title: Meme stocks like GameStop and BlackBerry are back. Here's why.
item.description: AMC and BlackBerry joined the meme stock surge on Tuesday as investors posted screenshots of their trading gains.

item.title: Blinken visits Ukraine to offer reassurance as Russia seizes new ground
item.description: America's top diplomat visits Kyiv, says U.S. weapons will make a "real difference" as Ukraine faces a fierce new Russian offensive

item.title: Arizona high court gives state AG 90 more days to act on near-total abortion ban
item.description: Arizona's highest court gave the state attorney general 90 additional days to decide further legal action in the case over an 1864 near-total abortion ban lawmakers recently voted to repealâ€‹.

item.title: Why does Canada have so many wildfires?
item.description: Crews in Western Canada are currently facing 130 active wildfires, including 14 considered out of control. Here's why it's so bad.

item.title: Largest Latino civil rights organization to endorse Biden for reelection
item.description: UnidosUS Action Fund will formally endorse the Biden-Harris ticket at an event in Phoenix, Arizona, as recent polling shows President Biden trailing in the battleground state.

item.title: Boxer dies after being knocked out in pro debut in London
item.description: Sherif Lawal was knocked down by a blow to the head in the fourth round of a scheduled six-round middleweight fight.

item.title: Maryland votes in the Senate primary race Tuesday. Meet the candidates
item.description: The winner of Tuesday's Democratic primary will likely face off against former Gov. Larry Hogan in November.

item.title: Philadelphia Customs officers intercept package containing 60 dead butterflies
item.description: The package, which was en route from Portugal to Wayne County, Pennsylvania, contained 60 dead butterflies but no documentation, officials say.

item.title: Israel's Netanyahu says militants make up about half of Gaza deaths
item.description: Israel's leader acknowledges that more than half of those killed in Gaza are likely civilians, as the U.N. shifts to a lower estimate of women and children victims.

item.title: Body recovered after man, dog vanish with raft in Grand Canyon
item.description: Park officials said Thomas Robison was believed to have attempted to travel down the river with his dog on a wooden raft.

item.title: WNBA season getting underway featuring Caitlin Clark's debut and more
item.description: The WNBA is poised to tip off its 28th season with the Las Vegas Aces seeking a three-peat, Caitlin Clark debuting and the league growing faster than ever.

item.title: Biden administration announces new 100% tariffs on Chinese EVs
item.description: The Biden administration is dramatically increasing tariffs on items including Chinese EVs to solar cells, batteries, steel and more.

item.title: 66 LA County probation officers placed on leave after misconduct allegations
item.description: Of the 66 officers placed on leave, 39 were for general misconduct, including suspected use of excessive force, child endangerment or abuse, possession of contraband and negligent supervision.

item.title: Chicago Public Schools expert witness says in deposition that sexual assault is not always traumatic
item.description: A woman, now 38, says the pain she says she suffered at the hands of a Chicago Public Schools (CPS) high school English teacher more than 20 years ago remains fresh.

item.title: 3 men charged in Whitey Bulger's prison killing have plea deals
item.description: Three men charged in the 2018 prison killing of notorious Boston gangster James "Whitey" Bulger have reached plea deals with prosecutors, according to court papers filed Monday.

item.title: Solar storms cause GPS in tractors to temporarily break during height of planting season
item.description: Many tractors use GPS to plant precise rows to avoid gaps and overlap. Farmers rely on it to plant more efficiently and precisely.

item.title: U.S. recovering from pandemic learning loss, but gaps remain
item.description: American students are starting to recover from pandemic learning losses, according to a Harvard University study. But test scores still lag behind 2019 levels, and schools will soon run out of federal pandemic-era funding. CBS News reporter Taurean Small examines how different states are addressing challenges in the classroom and on the balance books.

item.title: U.S. honey bee population reaches record high
item.description: In 2006, bees across the U.S. started dying rapidly. Now, the U.S. honey bee population is at an all-time high, according to the Census of Agriculture. Clay Bolt, manager of pollinator conservation for the World Wildlife Fund U.S., joins CBS News to explain what happened.

item.title: CDC to publicly post wastewater data amid bird flu outbreak
item.description: As bird flu spreads among cows in the U.S., the CDC plans to publicly post data on a specific influenza virus found in wastewater. Dr. Celine Gounder, CBS News medical contributor and editor-at-large for public health at KFF, joins to break down the latest developments in tracking the virus.

item.title: Why are GameStop shares on the rise again?
item.description: The stock for video game retailer GameStop closed up 74% on Monday, harkening back to the buying frenzy in January 2021 fueled by traders on Reddit. Martin Baccardax, senior editor and chief markets correspondent for TheStreet, joins CBS News to examine what could be behind the stock's sudden surge.

item.title: Breaking down the charges against Sen. Bob Menendez
item.description: Gold bars, foreign entities and a new Mercedes-Benz are just some elements in the federal corruption trial of New Jersey Democratic Sen. Bob Menendez, which saw the start of jury selection on Monday. CBS News congressional correspondent Scott MacFarlane explains.

item.title: Crews demolish Key Bridge section to free cargo ship
item.description: Crews in Baltimore conducted a controlled demolition Monday of what remains of the collapsed Francis Scott Key Bridge. Officials say the demolition will help free the cargo ship that crashed into the bridge in March. CBS News Baltimore investigative reporter Mike Hellgren explains what happens next.

item.title: Takeaways from Michael Cohen's 1st day on the stand in Trump trial
item.description: Donald Trump's former lawyer and self-described "fixer" Michael Cohen took the stand Monday in the former president's criminal "hush money" trial. CBS News legal analyst Rikki Klieman, who was in the courtroom, joins to break down the testimony.

item.title: U.S., Israel relationship gets tense over Rafah approach
item.description: The U.S. is still pressing Israel over its planned ground operation in Gaza's southern city of Rafah. CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang breaks down how conversations are evolving.

item.title: Memorial Day weekend 2024 could be busiest for travel in nearly 20 years
item.description: AAA is expecting a nearly 5% bump in airline travel and a 4% increase in drivers this Memorial Day weekend.

item.title: Therapy dogs bring joy to government workers in Washington, D.C.
item.description: Four-legged friends are doing their part to bring smiles to government workers in Washington, D.C. The therapy dogs visited Capitol Hill, the State Department and USAID. CBS News' Natalie Brand tagged along for one of the canine visits.
